items.title: EMERGENCY SITUATIONS
items.long_description:
EMERGENCY SITUATIONS
FIRE OR SMOKE DETECTORS
Outside each apartment and throughout the hotel there are smoke detectors that will automatically commence the fire evacuation procedure for this hotel if activated.  They will also automatically alert the Fire Brigade to attend and once the alarm has been triggered this process cannot be stopped.

Inside your apartment there is also a smoke detector that will notify you in the case of smoke, this detector is not linked through to our fire panel.  The other Fire Suppression Systems in your room are activated by heat (such as detectors and sprinklers) and are also linked directly through to our Fire Panel and the Fire Brigade.

However, if you detect a fire, raise the alarm and contact reception by dialling 9.
Every minute counts.  An emergency plan is located on the back of the room door.  A call out fee may apply if the fire alarm is activated.

PREVENTION
Please take the time to familiarise yourself with the location of your room and the location of the nearest fire exit on your floor.  Please refer to the diagram located on the back of the room door for information and directions.
In the unlikely event that there is a fire or an emergency in the hotel:
1. Remain calm.
2. Inform Reception by dialling 9.
3. Listen out for the evacuation tones and follow any audible announcement.
4. Exit the building calmly using the closest Fire Exit stairway - do not use the elevators until advised it is safe to do so.
5. If you have a physical condition that might impair your ability to either detect an alarm or evacuate via the stairway, please notify Reception by dialling 9.

items.title: Eureka Skydeck
items.long_description:
285 Meters above ground and 38 seconds to get there.

Shoot to the dizzying heights of Eureka Skydeck and enjoy the most spectacular floor-to-ceiling, 360-degree views in Australia (the highest in the Southern Hemisphere).

See Melbourne’s finest views from almost 300 metres in the sky – Albert Park Lake, Port Phillip Bay, the Dandenong Ranges and beyond. There are 30 viewfinders around the Skydeck, take a look at some of Melbourne’s favourite attractions and landmarks, such as the MCG, Federation square and Flinders Street Station.

We’re also home to a world first, The Edge – this glass cube that projects from the 88th floor of the Eureka Tower and suspends visitors almost 300 meters high above Melbourne.
Plan the rest of your trip while you’re here, with free WIFI, a small kiosk with sandwiches and hot drinks and casual seating options, making it one of the best attractions if you are looking for things to do in Melbourne.

https://www.eurekaskydeck.com.au/see-do/skydeck/

items.title: Melbourne Zoo
items.long_description:
At Melbourne Zoo, you can meet over 300 different species from around the world, only minutes from the city centre! 

See majestic Asian Elephants, sleek Sumatran Tigers and Orangutans swinging through the trees. Visit the Gorilla Rainforest, or see koalas and kangaroos in our Australian bush setting. And discover our exciting new interactive exhibits designed especially for kids.You will get the chance to learn all about our animals, our fight to save wildlife from extinction and what you can do to help.

Located an easy tram ride from Pegasus, the Melbourne Zoo is a must visit for the whole family

https://www.zoo.org.au/melbourne

items.title: Sea Life Melbourne
items.long_description:
At Sea Life you'll encounter some of the world's most incredible animals, including : the beautiful penguins, huge sharks, massive sawfish, mysterious stingrays, jellyfish, seahorses, thousands of tropical fish and much, much more.

Victoria's Leading Attraction SEA LIFE Melbourne Aquarium is home to over 10,000 animals, including one of the world’s largest Saltwater Crocodiles in the state-of-the-art Croc Lair exhibit. SEA LIFE Melbourne Aquarium takes you on an interactive adventure from the depths of the ocean to the icy waters of Antarctica.

Victoria's Leading Attraction SEA LIFE Melbourne Aquarium is home to over 10,000 animals, including one of the world’s largest Saltwater Crocodiles in the state-of-the-art Croc Lair exhibit. SEA LIFE Melbourne Aquarium takes you on an interactive adventure from the depths of the ocean to the icy waters of Antarctica.

https://www.melbourneaquarium.com.au/#gref
